properties.event summary: 10/11/2011: On Tuesday in Coatzacoalcos, Veracruz, Mexico, five males were detained by military personnel from the 29th Military Zone and the following items were seized: seventeen dosages of cocaine, one grenade launcher, one grenade, 166 different caliber rounds of ammunition, two vehicles, and different types of materials. No casualties were reported. The suspects were not identified.
properties.event title: Five Males Detained and Contraband Seized in Coatzacoalcos, Veracruz
properties.location: The operation occurred in Coatzacoalcos, Veracruz, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 10/23/2011: On Sunday in Veracruz, Veracruz, Mexico, on Avenida Lopez Velarde, Colonia Hidalgo, a cell of the organized crime group Los Zetas was arrested by government forces. The arrest was part of Operation Veracruz Seguro. The men were arrested for possession of grenades and drug banners with wording that alluded to criminal groups. It was not released how many Zetas were arrested, but they were located aboard two vehicles. Mexican authorities seized grenade launchers, seven grenades, five drug banners, seven AK-47 rifles, 63 magazines, over 500 cartridges, five black ammunition belts, and two vehicles.
properties.event title: Cell of Los Zetas Captured; Contraband Seized in Veracruz, Mexico
properties.location: The operation occurred on Avenida Lopez Velarde, Colonia Hidalgo, Veracruz, Veracruz, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 10/01/2011 (default date): On Saturday, in Veracruz, Veracruz, Mexico, military personnel seized one 85 mm RPG-7 rocket launcher, an 85 mm rocket, and two hand grenades from an abandoned vehicle during a patrol.
properties.event title: Military Personnel Seize Contraband from Abandoned Vehicle in Veracruz
properties.location: The operation occurred in Veracruz, Veracruz, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 12/12/2011: On Monday, close to the Veracruz-Mexico road, near  Cordoba, Veracruz, Mexico clash between marines and Raul Lucio Hernandez Lechuga "El Lucky" resulted in the death of Hernandez Lechuga's bodyguard, the injuring of a marine, and the arrest of five. Mexican navy arrested Raul Lucio Hernandez Lechuga, also known as "El Lucky," "Z-16," or "el APA" who was one of the most wanted criminals by Mexican and American authorities because he is the alleged leader of Los Zetas in Hidalgo, Oaxaca, Puebla, Veracruz, Tabasco, Campeche, Queretaro, San Luis Potosi, Quintana Roo, and Mexico State. A year-long intelligence operation was carried out for his arrest. He is believed to be a direct collaborator with Heriberto Lazcano Lazcano "El Lazca," a co-founder of the group, and involved in the disappearance of nine navy personnel. Along with El Lucky, four other Los Zetas suspects were arrested, Germain Hernandez Flores "El Chino" who was the alleged leader of the tractor trailer theft cell, Nicolas Garcia Colorado "El Flaco," Rafael Menez Espinoza "Rafles," and Cristobal Saninas Vallejo "Don Gato." The last two men were allegedly in charge of vehicle maintenance and communications for the group. At the scene, 123 rifles, 36 handguns, one Barret rifle, five grenade launchers, 2641 magazines, approximately 28000 rounds of ammunition for various weapons, 29 grenades, one tractor trailer, one truck, one sedan, communications equipment, American military uniforms, shirts with SIEDO and AFI logos, bulletproof vests, and one vest with the Navy logo.
properties.event title: Raul Lucio Hernandez Lechuga and Four Other Militants Arrested by Navy in Veracruz
properties.location: The operation occurred close to the Veracruz-Mexico road near Cordoba, Veracruz, Mexico.
